result.execSummary:
The defendant Danielle S Peters was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain fulltime employment, schooling, or combination of the two of at least 30 hours per week, or if not then perform 10 hours community service per week.

Assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by agent.
DNA sample w/ surcharge.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: With huber for work, treatment, and childcare if defendant qualifies. To begin within 45 days at agent's discretion.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Case Called: 3:00 pm

State appears by ADA Kerri Puig; Def appears in person with Atty Andrew Morgan.

State moves to:

PLEA: 
In 15CF608: Ct. 1 (Felony Retail Theft/PTAC/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 13CF586: Ct. 1 (Misappropriate ID Info - Avoid Penalty/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
                    : Ct. 2 (Misd. Retail Theft/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 

COURT ORDERS: 
In 15CF608: Ct. 1>>SWH for 3 years probation - CONDITIONS: 9 months MCJ w/ huber for work/treatment/childcare if def qualifies to begin within 45 days of today's date at agent's discretion; assessment/treatment counseling as deemed appropriate by the agent; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 10 hours CS per week; DNA sample and surcharge; CC. 
In 13CF586: Ct. 1>>SWH for 3 years probation - CONDITIONS: assessment/treatment counseling as deemed appropriate by the agent; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 10 hours CS per week; letter of apology to A.S; CC. 
                    : Ct. 2>>SWH for 2 years probation - CONDITIONS: assessment/treatment counseling as deemed appropriate by the agent; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 10 hours CS per week; letter of apology to A.S; CC. 

COURT ORDERS all probation terms concurrent. 
COURT has no objection of transfer of probation and conditional jail to Shawno County. 
COURT finds def is entitled to NO days jail credit at this time. 
Parties to submit stipulation re: jail credit.
